This has led to severe economic hardship, including currency collapse and soaring food prices, while fears of renewed conflict with Israel and the US loom. Diplomacy remains uncertain amid intensifying internal repression.

Delhi 'godman' Swami Chaitanyananda, accused of molesting female students, arrested from Agra
description: Delhi Police arrested self-styled godman Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati in Agra, accused of sexually harassing 17 women students and orchestrating financial fraud. The 62-year-old allegedly exploited economically weaker students by seizing their phones and certificates, creating fear. His bail plea was rejected, with a court noting custodial interrogation is vital to unravel the extensive fraud and intimidation pattern.

description: Rashid Latif reignited the India-Pakistan rivalry debate ahead of the Asia Cup final, saying it will never end “as long as there is war.” While admitting India has the edge in skills, Latif stressed that the pressure will always be on India, who have “everything to lose,” while Pakistan, as underdogs, enter the contest with nothing to lose.

description: Daughter's Day, observed in India on September 28, 2025, celebrates the profound love and strength daughters bring to families. This special occasion originated to counter gender biases, advocating for equal rights, education, and opportunities for girls.

title: Dugong redux
description: A multi-stakeholder conservation project in the waters of the Palk Bay has resulted in a rise in the number of dugongs, once dwindling in the area. S. Ganesan and R. Rajaram examine what measures facilitated the return of these sea cows, and what more needs to be done, even as international recognition comes Tamil Nadu’s way

title: ‘Putin visit planned’: Lavrov confirms December trip to New Delhi
description: Russian foreign minister Sergey Lavrov announced President Putin's December visit to New Delhi, emphasising extensive bilateral cooperation. Lavrov affirmed India's independent trade decisions with Russia, despite US sanctions, highlighting their "particularly privileged strategic partnership." He also reiterated Russia's strong support for India's permanent seat on the UN Security Council, advocating for global representation.

title: Awareness meet at Anna Nagar Tower Park as culmination of a study on drug use among undergraduate students

title: Asia Cup final: Why India need Bumrah smiling again vs Pakistan - Can he deliver?
description: Jasprit Bumrah enters the Asia Cup final against Pakistan under unusual scrutiny. Tasked with an exceptionally demanding role of bowling three overs in the powerplay, he has looked uncharacteristically off-colour, even losing his trademark calm. With five wickets in four games, India will hope their “smiling assassin” rediscovers his spark and delivers when it matters most.

title: In Kolkata, poetry and art from Gaza and Bengal famine converge in Durga Puja pandal

Guided by mentor Yuvraj Singh’s gruelling 4am routines and Brian Lara’s golf lessons, the young left-hander has transformed into a six-hitting machine. With 309 runs at a strike rate over 200 in the Asia Cup, he has become India’s most destructive batting force.

Congress hit back, claiming AAP's foundation was RSS-backed and it seized power with false accusations. Meanwhile, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge condemned the Centre's handling of the situation. He demanded a judicial inquiry into police firing in Ladakh.

description: India has initiated the acquisition process for three regiments of indigenous "Anant Shastra" Quick Reaction Surface-to-Air Missile systems, costing Rs 30,000 crore. These highly mobile systems, developed by DRDO, will detect and destroy aerial threats over 30km, providing crucial air defence cover for troops and replacing older systems, especially after recent border hostilities.

title: Swachh Shehar Jodi: Ahmedabad, Surat, Vadodara & Gandhinagar  selected as Mentor Cities
'Swachh Shehar Jodi' launched to help 200 cities manage solid waste
description: The government launched the 'Swachh Shehar Jodi' programme to help 200 cities effectively manage municipal solid waste. This initiative pairs 72 mentor cities with 200 mentee cities, enabling them to learn and replicate best practices. Housing and Urban Affairs Minister Manohar Lal Khattar described it as a structured, outcome-driven mentorship for urban waste management.

title: Where generations live, learn, and love
description: A joint family is a deep living bond woven through generations

title: Draft bill to strengthen statistical institute unveiled
description: The central government has released a draft bill to significantly strengthen the Indian Statistical Institute. This legislation proposes a revamped, leaner governance structure and an empowered board, aiming to transform ISI into a world-leading institution by its 2031 centenary. The bill seeks to streamline decision-making and grant greater autonomy, ensuring world-class education and research.

title: Ambassadors of 11 countries visit Amul, Ray nano fertilizer firm in Anand district
Amit Shah sets 160+ target for NDA in Bihar elections
description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, during his Bihar visit, set an ambitious target of over 160 seats for BJP in the 2025 assembly elections. Addressing party workers, Shah urged them to publicize NDA's achievements and vowed to expel infiltrators.

title: Horoscope Today – 28 September 2025: What Do the Stars Hold for Leo, Pisces, Virgo, Aquarius and Taurus Today? Your Complete Astrological Guide
Two Bihar wetlands join global list of Ramsar sites
description: India has added two new wetlands in Bihar, Gokul Jalashay and Udaipur Jheel, to the global Ramsar list, increasing its total to 93 sites. This solidifies India's position as Asia's leader and third worldwide. These oxbow lakes support diverse biodiversity and local livelihoods, underscoring India's commitment to wetland conservation.

title: HP cold desert now on Unesco's list of biosphere reserves
description: Unesco has designated India's Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve in the western Himalayas as part of its global network, making it the 13th Indian site. This 7,770 sq km reserve, established in 2009, is home to rare species like the snow leopard and is India's first high-altitude cold desert reserve, promoting sustainable living.

title: BJP objects to Kaaba song at Bengal pandal in CM Mamata Banerjee's presence
description: BJP strongly criticized West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee after a song referencing Kaaba and Madinah was sung at a Durga pandal in her presence. The party labeled it "extremist and appeasement politics," questioning if it's part of the INDIA bloc's alleged agenda to "eradicate" Sanatan Dharma.

title: What does Trump’s latest H-1B directive state? | Explained
description: What will be the consequences for both American and immigrant workers? Do overseas workers displace Americans in tech jobs? What do surveys show? What are immigration lawyers saying? What are the trends likely to play out in the tech sector?

title: For decades now, major international attacks traced to Pakistan: EAM Jaishankar
description: India's Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar warned the UN against nations sponsoring terror, implicitly calling Pakistan a global terrorism epicentre. India's representative further lambasted Pakistan, citing its history of sheltering terrorists and sponsoring groups like 'The Resistance Front' responsible for attacks. New Delhi asserted accountability for terrorists and their sponsors, rejecting third-party mediation.

title: EC gears up for Bihar poll dates, announcement likely on October 6-7
description: The Election Commission is set to announce Bihar assembly poll dates soon after the final electoral roll publication on Sept 30. Key engagements include a meeting with observers on Oct 3 and a full commission visit to Bihar on Oct 4-5, with poll dates possibly declared by Oct 6 or 7.

title: Why are 5.3cr cases pending in Indian courts? Missing lawyers & witnesses, long stays...
description: The Supreme Court recently underscored speedy trial as an unimpeachable right amidst 5.34 crore pending cases nationwide. Key reasons for delays include unavailable counsels, absconding accused, and missing witnesses. The SC directed High Courts to ensure trials are not adjourned for counsel absence and proceed day-to-day, criticizing trial courts for flouting this mandate.

title: Watch: Vijay’s Karur rally turns deadly: 36 killed in stampede, probe ordered
description: A tragic stampede at actor-politician Vijay’s rally in Karur claimed at least 36 lives, including women and children, and left over 50 injured. The overcrowded event was part of Vijay’s state-wide tour. CM M.K. Stalin called the incident deeply concerning, ordered emergency response, and announced ₹10 lakh compensation for the victims’ families.

title: M.S. Swaminathan spoke on climate change 50 years ago, says Stalin

title: Gabrielle Union reveals her biggest fear after Dwyane Wade’s cancer diagnosis
description: Gabrielle Union revealed her biggest fear when Dwyane Wade was diagnosed with kidney cancer, admitting she worried about raising their children alone. His secrecy regarding his health decisions caused distrust, nearly bringing their marriage to rock bottom. Wade underwent surgery in December 2023 to remove 40% of his right kidney.

title: DMK refutes Vijay’s claim on memorial for Subbarayan
Kashmiri Pandit teacher left Valley in body, but never in spirit
description: Hirdey Nath Koul, beloved Kashmiri Pandit teacher and former Islamia High School principal, died at 93. Tributes highlighted his lifelong dedication to students and Kashmir, which he carried despite exile. The 1990s exodus shattered his heart, leaving him longing for his Srinagar home and cherished books until his final moments, embodying a poignant legacy.

title: From Jamtara to Dubai — the web of cyber fraudsters spreads fast

Microsoft faces Trump ire: Ex-president's past jobs flagged; what Trump said
description: Donald Trump publicly demanded Microsoft fire its new President of Global Affairs, Lisa Monaco, citing her past roles in the Obama and Biden administrations and her involvement in the January 6th response. Trump labeled Monaco a "menace to U.S. National Security," especially given Microsoft's government contracts. This call follows similar concerns raised by Laura Loomer.

More than seven decades of science for peace
description: The European Organization for Nuclear Research – you probably know it by its acronym CERN – came into existence on September 29, 1954. For over seven decades now, the intergovernmental organisation has been vocal in its call for science for peace, while probing the fundamental structure of particles that make up everything around us. In addition to major achievements in particle physics, the organisation has also been home to innovations and inventions that you might not readily associate with it. A.S.Ganesh offers a quick timeline delineating some of its major achievements...

Stephen A Smith slams Trump for blaming Left in Charlie Kirk’s killing

Smith argued Trump's polarizing comments deepened national division and fear instead of uniting people after the tragic September 10, 2025, incident. This sparked wider debate on political speech.

description: Build Canada urges the government to swiftly attract H-1B professionals displaced by new US visa fees. The memo highlights a $100,000 H-1B fee as a unique opportunity for Canada to gain skilled talent, potentially boosting GDP by $30 billion. It also warns of Canadian talent poaching by the US if no action is taken.

US student loan forgiveness backlog hits 74k under Trump: Here's why it's growing so fast
description: A growing backlog of 74,510 US student loan forgiveness applications under the PSLF Buyback programme remains unresolved under President Trump’s administration. The initiative, designed to credit missed public service months due to forbearance or deferment, has faced significant delays, partly due to staffing cuts at the Education Department. Legal action by the American Federation of Teachers has forced data disclosure. Borrowers and advocates urge continued applications despite processing slowdowns and pending repayment plan requests exceeding one million.

description: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk was arrested and moved to Jodhpur jail. Police accused him of provocative remarks and alleged Pakistan links. This followed violent clashes in Leh where four people died and many were injured. Authorities relaxed curfew amid public outrage. Kargil Democratic Alliance and Leh Bar Association defended Wangchuk, rejecting police claims and demanding a judicial probe.

title: Russia at UNGA: Lavrov pushes for permanent seat for India in UNSC - top quotes
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov backed a permanent United Nations Security Council seat for India. He spoke at the UNGA annual summit. Lavrov noted the world balance changed since the UN's start. Russia calls for Security Council reform by adding members from Asia, Africa, and Latin America. Russia supports India and Brazil for permanent council spots.

One can use their phones, laptops, smartwatches to give a ‘stay-away’ reminder every 20 minutes. Setting reminders makes the habit easier to maintain.

title: 'They didn’t want a Black character': Gabrielle Union on film rejection
description: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, recently spoke about facing discrimination in Hollywood. She revealed being rejected for a role due to her ethnicity. Union wanted to be in 'Sugar and Spice' but was turned down. She also discussed beauty standards and how they affected her career. Despite challenges, Union has achieved success. Her marriage with Wade inspires many.
